title: Yakima, Washington
summary: Yakima (/ˈjækɪmɑː/ or /ˈjækɪmə/) is a  city in and the county seat of Yakima County, Washington, and the state's eleventh-largest city by population. As of the 2010 census, the city had a total population of 91,067 and a metropolitan population of 243,231.[6] The unincorporated suburban areas of West Valley and Terrace Heights are considered a part of greater Yakima.[7]
